# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    col = strip(col) # Remove leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = lowercase(col) # Convert to lowercase
    col = replace(col, r"\s+" => "") # Remove multiple spaces
    col = replace(col, r"[-]+" => _) # Replace multiple hyphens and spaces with underscore
    col
end
```

Function `clean_column` takes a single argument `col` of AbstractString type, cleans it using the defined rules and returns the cleaned string. The regular expressions (r"\s+" and r"[-]+" ) are used to remove multiple leading/trailing whitespaces and multiple hyphens or spaces respectively. The `_` symbol is used as a placeholder for the replacement in the function `replace`.
